speech: Typhoid symptoms include prolonged high fever, fatigue, headache, nausea, abdominal pain, and constipation or diarrhoea. Some patients may have a rash. Severe cases may lead to serious complications or even death.

Diagnosis of typhoid fever is made when the Salmonella bacteria is detected with a stool culture. Antibiotics treat typhoid fever.
Typhoid fever symptoms are
1) poor appetite,
2) headaches,
3) diarrhea,
4) generalized aches and pains,
5) fever
6) lethargy.
